00026 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00027 // How does this work?
00028 // Remember that before the compiler starts to process a source file, it runs
00029 // a neat tool called a preprocessor on it. What this preprocessor does in
00030 // this case is replace all the instances of *alloc/free with the expanded
00031 // macros - this way we cleverly replace all the calls to the standard C
00032 // memory (de)allocation functions. The same is done for new/delete
00033 //
00034 // Of course, we have the drawback that we can't name a member function of
00035 // a class *alloc or free and we can't overlod the new/delete operators without
00036 // first undefining these macros - ah, a C++ preprocessor with RE replacement,
00037 // that would be a dream come true :)
00038 //
00039 #ifndef OGRE_MEMORY_MACROS
00040 #define OGRE_MEMORY_MACROS
00041 #define new new
00042 #define delete delete
00043 #define malloc( sz ) ::Ogre::MemoryManager::sMemManager.allocMem( __FILE__, __LINE__, sz )
00044 #define free( ptr ) ::Ogre::MemoryManager::sMemManager.dllocMem( __FILE__, __LINE__, ptr )
00045 #define realloc( ptr, sz ) ::Ogre::MemoryManager::sMemManager.rllocMem( __FILE__, __LINE__, ptr, sz )
00046 #define calloc( cnt, sz ) ::Ogre::MemoryManager::sMemManager.cllocMem( __FILE__, __LINE__, cnt, sz )
00047 #endif
00048 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
